Changed optimization level
Added link time optimization & parallel code generation units

**- How I did it**
Please install:
`install --force cargo-strip`

**- How to verify it**
To verify, run the following commands to nightly branch vs my branch to see some changes:
`cargo bloat --release -n 30`

candidates.title: Bump utoipa from 3.0.1 to 3.0.2

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

candidates.body:
Bumps [utoipa](https://github.com/juhaku/utoipa) from 3.0.1 to 3.0.2.
Release notes

Sourced from utoipa's releases.

utoipa-swagger-ui-3.0.2

What's New :gem: :new: :tada:

About a 1 year ago the first public release of utoipa was published. A 1 day less to be exact. It has been a long journey since the first release and the utoipa has seen countless improvements, even coming from the latest release a numerous things have been tinkered.

The API has seen quite a reform and it is unified across the board in many places. Missing attributes, configuration options and functionalities have been added to many places. Docs were improved a lot, a few bug fixes here and there and 2 new derive implementations were added.

Huge thanks to you dear contributor for your support and help in this project as well as those who have filed issues and created discussions on important matters that help to make this library better. :1st_place_medal:

This is a breaking release and there are few things to read through when you update to this release. You can read more from here: https://github.com/juhaku/utoipa/discussions/456

Note! Since utoipa-swagger-ui-3.0.2 the minimum utoipa version is 3.0.0. :exclamation:

  • (2e13074) Fix spelling (#450) @​jayvdb
  • (13a3aae) Update versions
  • (d8c5ec5) Swagger UI url config (#418) @​juhaku
  • (6c7f6a2) Improve documenetation
  • (63613c2) Add support for self referencing schema (#375) @​juhaku
  • (afa62d2) Update utoipa-swagger-ui install example

Full change log

utoipa-3.0.2

What's New :gem: :new: :tada:

  • (fe39928) Update next versions
  • (2986e5a) Enhance unit type support (#476) @​juhaku
  • (c4564ce) Add support for unit type () (#464) @​biwecka
  • (9124559) Support arbitrary exprs in operation_id (#472) @​djrenren

Full change log

utoipa-gen-3.0.2

What's New :gem: :new: :tada:

  • (fe39928) Update next versions
  • (2986e5a) Enhance unit type support (#476) @​juhaku
  • (c4564ce) Add support for unit type () (#464) @​biwecka
  • (9124559) Support arbitrary exprs in operation_id (#472) @​djrenren

Full change log

Commits
  • fe39928 Update next versions
  • 2986e5a Enhance unit type support (#476)
  • c4564ce Add support for unit type () (#464)
  • 9124559 Support arbitrary exprs in operation_id (#472)
  • See full diff in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=utoipa&package-manager=cargo&previous-version=3.0.1&new-version=3.0.2)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

candidates.body:
Bumps [utoipa](https://github.com/juhaku/utoipa) from 2.4.2 to 3.0.1.
Release notes

Sourced from utoipa's releases.

utoipa-swagger-ui-3.0.1

What's New :gem: :new: :tada:

  • (67b9585) Fix minum axum version info

Full change log

utoipa-3.0.1

What's New :gem: :new: :tada:

  • (96acebf) Update next versions
  • (6190978) Fix explicit lifetimes for consts (#467)

Full change log

utoipa-gen-3.0.1

What's New :gem: :new: :tada:

  • (96acebf) Update next versions
  • (6190978) Fix explicit lifetimes for consts (#467)

Full change log

utoipa-swagger-ui-3.0.0

What's New :gem: :new: :tada:

This release comes with latest release of axum framework which contain breaking changes. You may refer to axum documentation and examples related to axum for new changes. And of course deepest appreciation and thank you for helping to maintain this library.

  • (6971fb3) Update swagger-ui dependencies versions
  • (5b2c8ef) Update utoipa-swagger-ui version
  • (badb475) cargo format
  • (a6f41cf) Fix broken swagger-ui on axum (#370) @​simmsb
  • (b558b36) Update to axum 0.6.0 (#369) @​davidpdrsn

Full change log

utoipa-3.0.0

What's New :gem: :new: :tada:

About a 1 year ago the first public release of utoipa was published. A 1 day less to be exact. It has been a long journey since the first release and the utoipa has seen countless improvements, even coming from the latest release a numerous things have been tinkered.

The API has seen quite a reform and it is unified across the board in many places. Missing attributes, configuration options and functionalities have been added to many places. Docs were improved a lot, a few bug fixes here and there and 2 new derive implementations were added.

Huge thanks to you dear contributor for your support and help in this project as well as those who have filed issues and created discussions on important matters that help to make this library better. :1st_place_medal:

This is a breaking release and there are few things to read through when you update to this release. You can read more from here: https://github.com/juhaku/utoipa/discussions/456

  • (d19aadf) Refactor ToReponse trait (#460) @​juhaku
  • (11288c3) Refactor to schema casting as (#459) @​juhaku
  • (5b51eb4) Enhance generic aliases with lifetimes support (#458) @​juhaku
  • (46fe673) Enhance path tuple argument support (#455) @​juhaku
  • (2e13074) Fix spelling (#450) @​jayvdb
  • (b167838) Add support for serde skip_serializing (#438) @​Xenfo
  • (13a3aae) Update versions
  • (50ab67f) Update README

... (truncated)

Commits

  • 6190978 Fix explicit lifetimes for consts (#467)
  • d19aadf Refactor ToReponse trait (#460)
  • 11288c3 Refactor to schema casting as (#459)
  • 5b51eb4 Enhance generic aliases with lifetimes support (#458)
  • 7c971b1 Fix warp-todo example warning (#457)
  • 54aedf8 Update README.md

  • 2e13074 Fix spelling (#450)

candidates.title: [FEATURE] Nanocl and Nanocld state apply and revert
candidates.body:
<!--
Please make sure you've read and understood our contributing guidelines;

** Make sure all your commits include a signature generated with `git commit -s` **

If this is a bug fix, make sure your description includes "fixes #xxxx", or
"closes #xxxx"

Please provide the following information:
-->

**- What I did**

Added a feature to be able to send config directly to the daemon to describe his state
This can be `apply` to create or patch component inside the config file or `revert` to destroy them

**- How to verify it**

Run tests

```sh
cargo make test
```

candidates.title: [FEATURE] Run command inside a cargo
candidates.body:
<!--
Please make sure you've read and understood our contributing guidelines;

** Make sure all your commits include a signature generated with `git commit -s` **

If this is a bug fix, make sure your description includes "fixes #xxxx", or
"closes #xxxx"

Please provide the following information:
-->

**- What I did**
To solve https://github.com/nxthat/nanocl/issues/97
I created a method in nanocld that return a stream to have the status of the running command.
I also created the method in our library i need to add the feature inside the CLI

**- How to verify it**
Tests are already writen

```sh
cargo make cov
```

**- Description for the changelog**
<!--
Write a short (one line) summary that describes the changes in this
pull request for inclusion in the changelog:
-->


**- A picture of a cute animal (not mandatory but encouraged)**

candidates.title: [REFACTOR] Nanocld use build-time information
candidates.body:
<!--
Please make sure you've read and understood our contributing guidelines;

** Make sure all your commits include a signature generated with `git commit -s` **

If this is a bug fix, make sure your description includes "fixes #xxxx", or
"closes #xxxx"

Please provide the following information:
-->

**- What I did**
Use build-time in Nanocld to get `version` `architecture` and `git commit hash`  information.
To solve this issue: https://github.com/nxthat/nanocl/issues/96
I also removed the `scripts/version_patch.sh` since it's not needed anymore.

**- How I did it**
Added 2 function in build.rs to retrieve the information of the `git commit hash` and `architecture`
And used `env!` macro to set variable inside `bin/nanocld/src/version.rs`

**- How to verify it**
Run the tests

```sh
cargo make cov
```

candidates.title: [FEATURE] Nanocld namespace now have a default network
candidates.body:
<!--
Please make sure you've read and understood our contributing guidelines;

** Make sure all your commits include a signature generated with `git commit -s` **

If this is a bug fix, make sure your description includes "fixes #xxxx", or
"closes #xxxx"

Please provide the following information:
-->

**- What I did**
Now creating and deleting a namespace will create and remove his default network.

**- How I did it**
Added utils function to create and delete namespace.

**- How to verify it**
Run test
```sh
cargo make cov
```

candidates.title: Bump clap_complete from 4.0.7 to 4.1.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

candidates.body:
Bumps [clap_complete](https://github.com/clap-rs/clap) from 4.0.7 to 4.1.0.
Release notes

Sourced from clap_complete's releases.

v4.0.32

[4.0.32] - 2022-12-22

Fixes

  • (parser) When overriding required(true), consider args that conflict with its group

v4.0.31

[4.0.31] - 2022-12-22

Performance

  • Speed up parsing when a lot of different flags are present (100 unique flags)

v4.0.30

[4.0.30] - 2022-12-21

Fixes

  • (error) Improve error for args_conflicts_with_subcommand

v4.0.29

[4.0.29] - 2022-11-29

v4.0.28

[4.0.28] - 2022-11-29

Fixes

  • Fix wasm support which was broken in 4.0.27

v4.0.26

[4.0.26] - 2022-11-16

Fixes

  • (error) Fix typos in ContextKind::as_str

v4.0.25

[4.0.25] - 2022-11-15

Features

  • (error) Report available subcommands when required subcommand is missing

v4.0.24

[4.0.24] - 2022-11-14

Fixes

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from clap_complete's changelog.

[4.1.0] - 2023-01-13

Compatibility

MSRV changed to 1.64.0

For apps with custom --help and --version flags:

  • Descriptions for --help and --version changed

When apps have errors imitating clap's error style:

  • Error message style was changed, including
    • Moving away from "did you mean" to tips
    • Leading letter is lower case
    • "For more" added some punctuation

Features

  • ArgMatches::get_occurrences support for argument values to be grouped by their occurrence

Fixes

  • (derive) Allow upgrade_from when arguments / subcommands are explicitly marked as required
  • (help) Try be more clearer and succinct with --help and --version (also helps with overflow)
  • (error) Try to be more clearer and succinct with error messages
  • (error) Officially adopt an error style guide

[4.0.32] - 2022-12-22

Fixes

  • (parser) When overriding required(true), consider args that conflict with its group

[4.0.31] - 2022-12-22

Performance

  • Speed up parsing when a lot of different flags are present (100 unique flags)

[4.0.30] - 2022-12-21

Fixes

  • (error) Improve error for args_conflicts_with_subcommand

[4.0.29] - 2022-11-29

[4.0.28] - 2022-11-29

Fixes

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 34d856b chore: Release
  • 889ca7a chore: Bump versions for 4.1
  • 2bafb9b docs(contrib): Define a compatibility policy for help/error output
  • a41ca2e docs: Update changelog
  • 523adc2 Merge pull request #4635 from epage/stablize
  • b4f111a feat: Stablize ArgMatches::get_occurrences
  • 72749a3 Merge pull request #4630 from eguiraud/patch-1
  • 8431461 docs: prefer ok_or to ok_or_else in README example
  • 37d03bb Merge pull request #4627 from tmccombs/macro-cleanup
  • 65f9e0d refactor(derive): Clean up unnecessary noop parsing
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
